userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: My daughter had Eczema pretty bad and it's pretty much cleared up now. What worked for her was a change in her diet. She avoided sugars, except what was natural in 100% fruit juice. She also avoided other food items that caused her to be irritated such as wheat and dairy. After about a year or so her skin has cleared and itching has significantly reduced, almost to none.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: wear cotton gloves to sleep - scratching is worst at night. never sleep with the heater above 68 degrees - it's better to be colder and cover with a couple layers of blankets than sweat in your sleep and aggravate your skin.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: take warm showers not hot, the house heater should be no higher than 70 degrees, use dove soap, use fragrance free ( moisturizer eucerin in the winter cerave or a light eucerin after the winter) after shower within 2 minutes - if in crises use vaseline in entire body( i like to do it at night and use a old t-shirt to sleep) after shower within 2 minutes after you got out the shower - do this for 2 weeks. If you have eczema spots and need medication the best one over the counter is dermarest  - I do not use the daily antihistamine.

condition.description:
Eczema is a term for several different types of skin swelling. Eczema is also called dermatitis. It is not dangerous, but most types cause red, swollen and itchy skin. Factors that can cause eczema include other diseases, irritating substances, allergies and your genetic makeup. Eczema is not contagious.

The most common type of eczema is atopic dermatitis. It is an allergic condition that makes your skin dry and itchy. It is most common in babies and children.

Eczema is a chronic disease. You can prevent some types of eczema by avoiding irritants, stress, and the things you are allergic to.
condition.name: Eczema

carousel_items: Don't use bandages that restrict airflow over the area where you apply the medication (unless your doctor tells you to).
Can slow down skin healing.
Wash and dry the area before using the medication, and wash and dry your hands before and after you apply the medication.
Don't use on skin that's been cut or bleeding.
Avoid using near your face, underarms, or groin unless told to by your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a topical corticosteroid (anti-inflammatory medicine). It reduces redness, itching, and swelling caused by inflammatory skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone works well for itchy, red skin, but over time steroids can make your skin thin and prone to infections.
downsides: Can slow down wound healing.
Because it's a steroid, it can thin healthy skin and make it more susceptible to infections or cuts.

downsides_processed.orig: Can slow down wound healing.
Because it's a steroid, it can thin healthy skin and make it more susceptible to infections or cuts.

upsides: Effective at treating the itchiness and redness of rashes and skin irritation.
Available in generic.
Can be used with other medications if there is a skin infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at treating the itchiness and redness of rashes and skin irritation.
Available in generic.
Can be used with other medications if there is a skin infection.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you are using Fluticasone, especially over a wide area of the skin for a long time and if you're using bandages that prevent airflow over the area. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Use this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
risk_factors: Using bandages that restrict airflow and using over a wide area of the skin for a long time

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you are using Fluticasone, especially over a wide area of the skin for a long time and if you're using bandages that prevent airflow over the area. carousel_items: Take it once a day to control asthma and allergy symptoms.
If you're using it for asthma or allergies, take it in the evening.
Use it 2 hours before exercising.
Granules can be taken by mouth or dissolved in liquid or soft food.
Doesn't treat sudden wheezing or asthma attacks once they start. Keep a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you.
The chewable tablets contain aspartame, so don't use them if you have a sensitivity to phenylalanine or phenylketones.

clock.tip: Works slower when taken with food.
Works slower when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Montelukast is a leukotriene inhibitor. It lowers inflammation in your lungs and nasal passages to prevent asthma and relieve allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Montelukast has fewer side effects but doesn't work as well as steroid inhalers for asthma. It also helps with allergies.
downsides: You have to use Montelukast every day to control your symptoms.
Somewhat less effective than corticosteroid inhalers for asthma.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.
Can cause behavior changes, agitation, aggression, and difficulty sleeping for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Montelukast every day to control your symptoms.
Somewhat less effective than corticosteroid inhalers for asthma.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.
Can cause behavior changes, agitation, aggression, and difficulty sleeping for some people.

upsides: Prevents symptoms and improves lung function in children and adults with chronic asthma.
A single 10 mg dose improves exercise-induced asthma symptoms for up to 24 hours.
Fewer side effects compared to other asthma treatments.
Also relieves nasal allergy symptoms.
Effective pill alternative to corticosteroid inhalers.

upsides_processed.orig: Prevents symptoms and improves lung function in children and adults with chronic asthma.
A single 10 mg dose improves exercise-induced asthma symptoms for up to 24 hours.
Fewer side effects compared to other asthma treatments.
Also relieves nasal allergy symptoms.
Effective pill alternative to corticosteroid inhalers.

userStories.tip: I was using many years. In 2005 I had a bleeding episode that could have been a side effect. in 2012 I had my first seizure and decided to read all my med labels. I quit Singular that day.

My daughter was prescribed Singulair when she was six. Horrible side effects to mental and cognitive functioning. Learned after the fact some singular has similar effects on other kids. Parents beware.
I can't take inhaled corticosteroids to control my asthma. This has worked quite well meanwhile..

I wish I hadn't let the fear of the depression side effect prevent me from taking singular for so long,  it works where inhalers do not work for me, and it controls my asthma well in generic montelukast form or Singulair form.
Don't skip a day because it isn't fast acting.  My cat allergies act up for days after being near a cat.

My insurance refuses to cover Singulair, but the generic form doesn't seem to control my asthma as well. One of my pharmacists told me this was the case for himself as well, and that generic was better just for allergies. Singulair is $$$
Caused major depression and angry outbursts which is very unusual for me. I ended up taking half dosage along with St Johns Wort to balance.

For the first several months I did not follow the instructions and took it in the morning (alongside Allegra, Zyrtec, whatever I was using at the time). Now I take it at night and it's far more effective for managing asthma symptoms.
Works perfectly without any side effect, just one pill before going to bed.
I take it at night, along with 2 puffs of Symbicort 80/4.5mcg

drugs.name: Singulair

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it once a day to control asthma and allergy symptoms.
If you're using it for asthma or allergies, take it in the evening.
Use it 2 hours before exercising.
Granules can be taken by mouth or dissolved in liquid or soft food.
Doesn't treat sudden wheezing or asthma attacks once they start. Keep a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you.
The chewable tablets contain aspartame, so don't use them if you have a sensitivity to phenylalanine or phenylketones.

risks_warnings.title: Sudden onset of asthma
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Aggression and agitation
risks_warnings.description: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. Symptoms range from irritability and memory problems to hallucinations and suicidal thinking. It is not clear if this is linked to history of these conditions. Get medical help immediately if you notice symptoms of agitation, aggression, sleep disturbance, or suicidal thoughts while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. Symptoms range from irritability and memory problems to hallucinations and suicidal thinking. It is not clear if this is linked to history of these conditions. Get medical help immediately if you notice symptoms of agitation, aggression, sleep disturbance, or suicidal thoughts while taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorder (eosinophilia)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of a blood disorder in people taking Montelukast. It's not clear what the link is between this blood vessel condition and Montelukast. Talk to your doctor if you notice red patches/rash or skin color changes on lower legs, numbness/tingling, or worsening of your asthma symptoms. You may need to stop taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of a blood disorder in people taking Montelukast. It's not clear what the link is between this blood vessel condition and Montelukast. Talk to your doctor if you notice red patches/rash or skin color changes on lower legs, numbness/tingling, or worsening of your asthma symptoms. You may need to stop taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

description_processed.orig: Montelukast contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver injury in people taking Montelukast mostly in combination with other factors such as drugs, alcohol, and liver disease. If you have any of these risk factors, your doctor will need to check your liver function periodically.
risk_factors: History of liver disease including hepatitis
Other medications that cause liver injury

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver injury in people taking Montelukast mostly in combination with other factors such as drugs, alcohol, and liver disease. If you have any of these risk factors, your doctor will need to check your liver function periodically.

carousel_items: Stop using this product if your skin condition gets worse or if a rash develops.
Don't let it get in your eyes, on your lips, or on your nose.
Apply Urea to the affected areas of skin twice a day.
Rub it in until it's completely absorbed.
Wash your hands well each time after applying it.

basics.benefits_moa: Urea softens thickened areas of the skin by gently loosening the horny layer of skin and causing scaly skin to shed.
basics.bottom_line: Urea treats a variety of skin conditions, but shouldnâ€™t be used by children.
downsides: Urea can cause skin stinging, burning, itching, or irritation.
Can't be used by children.
Pregnant women need to talk with their doctors before using Urea.

carousel_items: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Acyclovir.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Acyclovir as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

basics.benefits_moa: Acyclovir is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Acyclovir is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Acyclovir is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Acyclovir for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.
You need to take this up to five times a day, so it can be inconvenient.

downsides_processed.orig: Acyclovir is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Acyclovir for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.
You need to take this up to five times a day, so it can be inconvenient.

upsides: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Acyclovir.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.

upsides_processed.orig: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Acyclovir.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Acyclovir.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Acyclovir as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Acyclovir who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Acyclovir.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Acyclovir who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Acyclovir.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

description_processed.orig: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

risks_warnings.title: Confusion
risks_warnings.description: Elderly people are more likely to have more confusion while on Acyclovir. Look for signs of tiredness, confusion, and even hallucinations if using this in elderly patients.

description_processed.orig: Elderly people are more likely to have more confusion while on Acyclovir. Look for signs of tiredness, confusion, and even hallucinations if using this in elderly patients.

carousel_items: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyrtec is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. Antihistamines can also make you sleepy, but Zyrtec is a low-drowsiness version.
basics.bottom_line: Zyrtec is a once-daily allergy relief medication that won't make you feel too sleepy.
downsides: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

downsides_processed.orig: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

upsides: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.
It comes as a tablet, liquid, and quick-dissolving tablet.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

upsides_processed.orig: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.
It comes as a tablet, liquid, and quick-dissolving tablet.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

userStories.tip: If you have been suffering with allergies for day , you may need to take Zyrtec for a few days, even though many say it works within the first day.  It does if your just getting symptoms.  It will work though.
Take it at night. I found that it makes me slightly drowsy for 6-8 hours, so by taking it at night, I wake up without any drowsiness. The drowsiness is minimal for me, but noticeable
I often find that its suppression of allergy symptoms only lasts 12 hours,  rather than the 24 they claim.

Found out online that Zyrtec was going to be approved for chronic hives. Glory saints hallelujah I was so happy to discover it. Nothing else worked. Benedryl and other fast acting antihistimines were not making a dent, and slathering myself
Take it at night to help with drowsiness.
I appreciate that Zyrtec works without making me tired. I wish I had found the generic version at Costco more quickly!

I have multiple allergies & Zyrtec keeps them under control year-round (along with Singulaire for food allergies & Flonase for pollen.) I like it because it doesn't make me woozy the way Claritin does. Best taken right before bed.
Take in the evening
A godsend. I'm not sure it's working as well after 10+ years.

drugs.name: Zyrtec

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

description_processed.orig: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Overdosage
risks_warnings.description: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.

description_processed.orig: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.

carousel_items: The shampoo is meant to be used once every 3 to 4 days, while the cream, gel and foam are meant to be used one to three times a day.
It can take at least 2 to 6 weeks for the infection to completely clear, and it can take 3 to 6 months before the skin returns to its original color for some infections.
Make sure Ketoconazole doesn't get into the eyes.
If you're using the foam, spray the foam into the cap, not your hands since it can melt before you put it on, and apply onto the skin, not the hair.
Can cause redness, swelling, and an irritated or burning sensation to the area where you put Ketoconazole on.

basics.benefits_moa: Ketoconazole is an antifungal medicine. It prevents yeast and fungi from reproducing and making their protective outer cell wall.
basics.bottom_line: Ketoconazole is a medication used on your skin to treat fungal infections; however, it takes several weeks for full recovery, and the directions are specific to each type of medication.
downsides: The foams (Extina and Ketodan) and gel (Xolegel) are only available as brand name and can be more expensive.
The 2.5% shampoo and creams are available only by prescription, but are generic.
The shampoo has to be left on for at least 5-10 minutes after lathering before you rinse it off.
It can take a few weeks for the infection to clear and a few months before the skin returns to its normal color.
The fungal infections can be confused for other skin infections, so if Ketoconazole doesn't work, it could be caused by another skin problem.

It can take a few weeks for the infection to clear and a few months before the skin returns to its normal color.
The fungal infections can be confused for other skin infections, so if Ketoconazole doesn't work, it could be caused by another skin problem.

upsides: Recommended as a first choice medication to treat skin infections caused by fungi, including cradle cap, seborrheic dermatitis, and tinea versicolor.
Ketoconazole isn't taken orally, so it doesn't cause liver issues.
Can be used with other medications to help control redness and swelling.
The 1% shampoo is available over-the-counter in the drugstore.

upsides_processed.orig: Recommended as a first choice medication to treat skin infections caused by fungi, including cradle cap, seborrheic dermatitis, and tinea versicolor.
Ketoconazole isn't taken orally, so it doesn't cause liver issues.

userStories.tip: works great on sebbhoreaic dermatitis on my face.  clears things up pretty much immediately

drugs.name: Ketoconazole

carousel_items_processed.orig: The shampoo is meant to be used once every 3 to 4 days, while the cream, gel and foam are meant to be used one to three times a day.
It can take at least 2 to 6 weeks for the infection to completely clear, and it can take 3 to 6 months before the skin returns to its original color for some infections.
Make sure Ketoconazole doesn't get into the eyes.
If you're using the foam, spray the foam into the cap, not your hands since it can melt before you put it on, and apply onto the skin, not the hair.
Can cause redness, swelling, and an irritated or burning sensation to the area where you put Ketoconazole on.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Ketoconazole can contain sodium sulfite anhydrous, a sulfite that can cause allergic-type reactions including severe asthmatic episodes in people with asthma.

description_processed.orig: Ketoconazole can contain sodium sulfite anhydrous, a sulfite that can cause allergic-type reactions including severe asthmatic episodes in people with asthma.

carousel_items: Stop using this product if your skin condition gets worse or if a rash develops.
Don't let it get in your eyes, on your lips, or on your nose.
Apply Urea to the affected areas of skin twice a day.
Rub it in until it's completely absorbed.
Wash your hands well each time after applying it.

basics.benefits_moa: Urea softens thickened areas of the skin by gently loosening the horny layer of skin and causing scaly skin to shed.
basics.bottom_line: Urea treats a variety of skin conditions, but shouldnâ€™t be used by children.
downsides: Urea can cause skin stinging, burning, itching, or irritation.
Can't be used by children.
Pregnant women need to talk with their doctors before using Urea.

downsides_processed.orig: Urea can cause skin stinging, burning, itching, or irritation.
Can't be used by children.
Pregnant women need to talk with their doctors before using Urea.

upsides: Urea is useful for treating hyperkeratotic (thickened) skin conditions such as dry, rough skin, skin cracks and fissures, dermatitis, eczema, psoriasis, keratoses, and calluses.
Side effects normally disappear after you stop using Urea.

upsides_processed.orig: Urea is useful for treating hyperkeratotic (thickened) skin conditions such as dry, rough skin, skin cracks and fissures, dermatitis, eczema, psoriasis, keratoses, and calluses.
Side effects normally disappear after you stop using Urea.

Apply Urea to the affected areas of skin twice a day.

points.name: Temporary stinging, burning, itching or irritation

carousel_items: Apply only to the areas where you have eczema.
Use only as long as your doctor tells you to. Donâ€™t use for a longer period of time.
May cause some burning, stinging, or itching at first, but this usually goes away as your skin gets used to the medicine.
When you apply Tacrolimus on your skin, donâ€™t cover that area with bandages or dressings.
Donâ€™t apply to infected areas of your skin. Let your doctor know if you have an infection.
Donâ€™t use sun lamps or tanning beds. Try to limit your time outside in the sun, but if you need to go out, use sun protection.

basics.benefits_moa: Tacrolimus is a topical calcineurin inhibitor. It works by blocking the inflammatory process, so your skin wonâ€™t react as much to irritants that make your eczema worse.
basics.bottom_line: Tacrolimus is effective at treating eczema if other options havenâ€™t helped, but its long-term effects arenâ€™t well known. Your doctor will decide how long you should use it for.
downsides: Not available in a generic form.
Canâ€™t be used in children under ages 2 years old.
Canâ€™t be used if your immune system is weak (for example, if you have cancer or are taking steroids for a long time).
Not recommended to be used for a very long period of time. If you have to keep using Tacrolimus, your doctor will probably have you take breaks in-between.

downsides_processed.orig: Not available in a generic form.

Canâ€™t be used if your immune system is weak (for example, if you have cancer or are taking steroids for a long time).
Not recommended to be used for a very long period of time. If you have to keep using Tacrolimus, your doctor will probably have you take breaks in-between.

upsides: Tacrolimus is effective at treating eczema, if other options havenâ€™t worked or shouldnâ€™t be used.
Many people see an improvement in their skin in as early as one week.
Doesnâ€™t have alcohol in it, so it wonâ€™t dry your skin out.

userStories.identifier: Disabled due to a neck injury.

drugs.name: Protopic

carousel_items_processed.orig: Apply only to the areas where you have eczema.
Use only as long as your doctor tells you to. Donâ€™t use for a longer period of time.
May cause some burning, stinging, or itching at first, but this usually goes away as your skin gets used to the medicine.
When you apply Tacrolimus on your skin, donâ€™t cover that area with bandages or dressings.
Donâ€™t apply to infected areas of your skin. Let your doctor know if you have an infection.
Donâ€™t use sun lamps or tanning beds. Try to limit your time outside in the sun, but if you need to go out, use sun protection.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Cancers of the skin and lymphatic system have been reported in patients using Tacrolimus. However, this is very rare, and it hasnâ€™t been established that Tacrolimus causes these malignancies. You should apply Tacrolimus only to the affected areas of your skin, and use for short periods only. Your doctor will decide how long you should be using Tacrolimus.

description_processed.orig: Cancers of the skin and lymphatic system have been reported in patients using Tacrolimus. However, this is very rare, and it hasnâ€™t been established that Tacrolimus causes these malignancies. You should apply Tacrolimus only to the affected areas of your skin, and use for short periods only. Your doctor will decide how long you should be using Tacrolimus.

risks_warnings.title: Using in young children
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus should not be used in children younger than 2 years old. Only the 0.03% ointment, the lowest strength, should be used in children ages 2 to 15 years old.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus should not be used in children younger than 2 years old. Only the 0.03% ointment, the lowest strength, should be used in children ages 2 to 15 years old.

risks_warnings.title: Infection
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus has been linked to viral skin infections, such as herpes simplex, varicella zoster, and eczema herpeticum. Don't apply Tacrolimus to areas of the skin that are infected. If you're using Tacrolimus and think your skin has an infection, stop using the medicine and let your doctor know.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus has been linked to viral skin infections, such as herpes simplex, varicella zoster, and eczema herpeticum. Don't apply Tacrolimus to areas of the skin that are infected. If you're using Tacrolimus and think your skin has an infection, stop using the medicine and let your doctor know.

risks_warnings.title: Swollen lymph nodes
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus has been linked to people having swollen lymph nodes. If your lymph nodes start to feel swollen, this might mean that you have an infection. If this happens, you should stop using Tacrolimus and let your doctor know.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus has been linked to people having swollen lymph nodes. If your lymph nodes start to feel swollen, this might mean that you have an infection. If this happens, you should stop using Tacrolimus and let your doctor know.

carousel_items: If you're sexually active, you and your partner should use birth control, since Azathioprine can cause birth defects.
If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, your joint damage canâ€™t be reversed, so keep up with your physical therapy and get plenty of rest.
While taking Azathioprine, your body is susceptible to infection; so be sure to wash your hands often and keep distance from with people who are sick.
It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

basics.benefits_moa: Azathioprine is an immunosuppressant medication. It blocks the production of the white blood cells that kill unfamiliar cells.
basics.bottom_line: Azathioprine is an effective medication for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and transplant rejection, but comes with a heavy list of side effects.
downsides: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

downsides_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

upsides: Azathioprine has proven to be effective in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
Azathioprine decreases the pain, stiffness, and swelling that most people have with rheumatoid arthritis.
You can still get vaccinated for the flu while taking Azathioprine.
Drinking alcohol is okay while taking Azathioprine.
Most side effects are temporary.

upsides_processed.orig: Azathioprine has proven to be effective in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
Azathioprine decreases the pain, stiffness, and swelling that most people have with rheumatoid arthritis.
You can still get vaccinated for the flu while taking Azathioprine.
Drinking alcohol is okay while taking Azathioprine.
Most side effects are temporary.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents organ rejection and relieves joint pain and inflammation.

userStories.tip: It attacked my liver and kidneys.  I developed drug induced diabetes.  Everything cleared up when I was switched to cellcept.

userStories.identifier: busy Engineer with severe Crohn's Diseas
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: One of the side effect was muscular and skeletal pain. After 2-3 weeks on the medication I was unable to walk without the aid of two walking sticks. Symptoms last for many months after stopping the medication.

drugs.name: Imuran

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you're sexually active, you and your partner should use birth control, since Azathioprine can cause birth defects.
If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, your joint damage canâ€™t be reversed, so keep up with your physical therapy and get plenty of rest.
While taking Azathioprine, your body is susceptible to infection; so be sure to wash your hands often and keep distance from with people who are sick.
It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Azathioprine has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Azathioprine has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

risks_warnings.title: Decreased blood cells
risks_warnings.description: Though your doctor will order tests to make sure the level of Azathioprine in your blood is safe, can cause a decrease in the amount of blood cells your body has. This may also lead to a suppression and toxicity of your bone marrow. People with low to no thiopurine S-methyltransferase (TMPT) activity have a higher chance of this.

description_processed.orig: Though your doctor will order tests to make sure the level of Azathioprine in your blood is safe, can cause a decrease in the amount of blood cells your body has. This may also lead to a suppression and toxicity of your bone marrow. People with low to no thiopurine S-methyltransferase (TMPT) activity have a higher chance of this.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infection
risks_warnings.description: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

description_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Azathioprine has been known to cause a decrease in the amount, and quality of sperm temporarily. It has also been known to cause harm to the fetus. For these reasons, it is important to use medically acceptable forms of contraception while receiving Azathioprine. In certain conditions however, the benefits of taking Azathioprine outweigh the risks, and pregnant women should continue taking it.

description_processed.orig: Azathioprine has been known to cause a decrease in the amount, and quality of sperm temporarily. It has also been known to cause harm to the fetus. For these reasons, it is important to use medically acceptable forms of contraception while receiving Azathioprine. In certain conditions however, the benefits of taking Azathioprine outweigh the risks, and pregnant women should continue taking it.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: My daughter had Eczema pretty bad and it's pretty much cleared up now. What worked for her was a change in her diet. She avoided sugars, except what was natural in 100% fruit juice. She also avoided other food items that caused her to be irritated such as wheat and dairy. After about a year or so her skin has cleared and itching has significantly reduced, almost to none.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: wear cotton gloves to sleep - scratching is worst at night. never sleep with the heater above 68 degrees - it's better to be colder and cover with a couple layers of blankets than sweat in your sleep and aggravate your skin.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Medication worked the least - Meditation, yoga, seal body's moisture after shower with eucerin or vaseline.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: take warm showers not hot, the house heater should be no higher than 70 degrees, use dove soap, use fragrance free ( moisturizer eucerin in the winter cerave or a light eucerin after the winter) after shower within 2 minutes - if in crises use vaseline in entire body( i like to do it at night and use a old t-shirt to sleep) after shower within 2 minutes after you got out the shower - do this for 2 weeks. If you have eczema spots and need medication the best one over the counter is dermarest  - I do not use the daily antihistamine.
